content:
I can point out some of the potential downsides of the rise of streaming platforms in the music industry:

1. low revenue for artists: many artists and labels have criticized streaming platforms for paying out low royalties compared to the number of streams. the revenue generated from streaming services may not be enough for artists to earn a comfortable living.

2. lack of artistic control: some artists and fans feel that the focus on "hit singles" has led to a lack of artistic control in the industry, with labels and streaming services encouraging artists to make music that will perform well on charts and playlists.

3. diminished album format: with the rise of streaming platforms, the album format has diminished in importance. some artists may feel limited in expressing themselves creatively if they are pressured to make hit singles rather than cohesive albums.

4. discovery challenges: while streaming services offer listeners access to more music than ever before, the sheer volume of music on these platforms can make it challenging for new and emerging artists to get discovered and build a significant audience.

overall, while streaming platforms have brought many positive changes to the music industry, some artists and fans remain concerned about the potential downsides of these platforms on creativity, revenue, and discovery.
